interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mile in His Shoes
Review Date: 2018/03/04
Store: Dean Cain  (Actor),     Luke Schroder  (Actor),     -  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ['Only a miracle can help baseball coach Arthur “Murph” Murphy (Dean Cain) and his losing minor league baseball team. As Murph sets out to recruit new talent for the team, he stumbles upon Mickey (Luke Schroder), a young farmer with an incredible pitcher’s arm. However, Mickey’s parents are reluctant to allow him to join the team because he has Asperger’s syndrome, a form of autism. Murph convinces Mickey’s parents that life in the minor league will benefit their unique son, but he doesn’t realize just how much his new recruit will help the team’s game and, more importantly, their spirit. Based on the novel “The Legend 0f Mickey Tussler” by Frank Nappi.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Luke Schroder, Dean Cain, -', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8687026', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 10, 2012', 'Actors': 'Dean Cain, Luke Schroder', 'Studio': 'Nasser', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Such a good and heartfelt movie, everyone needs to watch and get and understanding and clarification on what the autistic children go through
Review Title: A movie everyone needs to see
Rating: 5.0

Mile in His Shoes
Dean Cain  (Actor),     Luke Schroder  (Actor),     -  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
['Only a miracle can help baseball coach Arthur “Murph” Murphy (Dean Cain) and his losing minor league baseball team. As Murph sets out to recruit new talent for the team, he stumbles upon Mickey (Luke Schroder), a young farmer with an incredible pitcher’s arm. However, Mickey’s parents are reluctant to allow him to join the team because he has Asperger’s syndrome, a form of autism. Murph convinces Mickey’s parents that life in the minor league will benefit their unique son, but he doesn’t realize just how much his new recruit will help the team’s game and, more importantly, their spirit. Based on the novel “The Legend 0f Mickey Tussler” by Frank Nappi.']

profile:
**User Preferences Summary:**

- **Content Type:** While the user has a strong preference for comedy movies, recent interactions indicate an openness to heartfelt dramas that tackle meaningful themes.
- **Familiarity with Creators:** The user still demonstrates loyalty to familiar creators, as reflected in past interactions with works by Tyler Perry. The engagement with a new film featuring Dean Cain suggests a willingness to explore different actors within the genre.
- **Engagement with Formats:** Continues to prefer physical media formats like DVDs, indicating a fondness for tangible collections and a traditional viewing experience.
- **Rating Behavior:** Consistently provides high ratings (5.0) for films that resonate with them, reflecting a positivity bias and an appreciation for both entertainment value and emotional impact.
- **Enjoyment of Sequels:** While previous enjoyment of sequels is noted, the latest review emphasizes a preference for films that provide meaningful narratives, regardless of them being sequels or standalone stories.
- **Humor Appreciation:** Maintains a core appreciation for humor, but also values films with heartfelt messages that foster understanding of important social issues, such as autism.

This profile illustrates a user who seeks out a variety of films—primarily comedies but with an increasing interest in impactful dramas—while favoring familiar creators and maintaining a love for DVD collections.
